content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can write the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_text, "\n")
        end
        push!(wrapped_text, word)
        push!(wrapped_text, " ")
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

Now let's provide an example:

```julia
text = "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)

println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output a wrapped version of the input text, with each line not exceeding 10 characters (excluding spaces).
